titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Frank Patrick Gilman (1853-1918) was educated at Princeton University (1879) and Princeton Theological Seminary (1885). He was ordained from the Presbytery of Rochester and appointed to the Hainan Mission in China by the Board of Foreign Missions in 1885. He died there in service in 1918.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes material related to Gilman's work in China and some family records of Mabel Gordon White and Wellington White, who may have been Gilman's wife's parents. There is also correspondence to family members; reports by Gilman from the mission in Hainan; a handwritten manuscript of "Hainan and its Mission Work," written by Gilman in 1890; photographs of the mission, missionaries, and Chinese people; postcards; newsletters; diplomas; some financial information; miscellaneous travel brochures from European cities; missionary newsletters; a manuscript of a newsletter article from 1885; and newspaper clippings.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Presbyterian Historical Society: Frank Patrick Gilman papers (RG 56).
